column9: Sun Quan inherits his familyâ€™s control of the southeast, building Eastern Wu along the Yangtze River.

column19: The Battle of Red Cliffs enabled Eastern Wu to completely break free from the suppression by Shu and Wei.

column9: Lu Meng, disguised as a commoner, crossed the Yangtze River and launched a surprise attack on Jingzhou, gaining a crucial geographical advantage.

In Sun Quan's later years, the Eastern Wu court was divided into two groups: one supporting Crown Prince Sun and the other supporting Prince Lu. The conflict between these groups weakened the strength of Eastern Wu.
Jin forces conquer Eastern Wu, ending the Three Kingdoms period and unifying China once more.
